Description: Mould-made pottery `Frog Type' lamp with a deep body and a stub-handle at the rear. The top is decorated with a frog. On the undefined base is an impressed branch and tendrils on a double base-line, with a curved line on one side and a star on the other.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q2139)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Wellcome Institute for the History of Medicine (trustees)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Sir Henry Solomon Wellcome
